Bottle @ DRBSG14. Dark brown body with a small offwhite head. Chocolate, roasted malt, dark fruit.
Bottle @ Danish Ratebeer Summer Gathering, 2014. Pours black with a small beige head. Roast, coffee, chocolate and ashes. Sweet but quite tasty!
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a medium off white head. The aroma is dark roasted with caramel notes. The flavor is sweet malty with chocolate roasted notes.

50 cL bottle. Pours hazy brown to black with a small tan head. Aroma is roasted malty and caramelish. Chocolate, caramelish and toasted malty. Lingering dark malty and toasted. Smooth fruity and caramelish finish.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear very dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malty, chocolate and coffee. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. 300814

Bottle, 9%. Very dark brown with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, caramel, bread and a little liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, medium sweet, chocolate, little liquorice, hop and medium bitter.

Bottle 500ml @ fonefan
Pours reddish brown with a tan head. Aroma has notes roasted malt, burned brown sugar, coffee and chocolate. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long burned sugar, coffee and chocolate finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. A dense, finger-thick beige head forms over a clear, reddish dark brown body. The aroma has some oxidied malts, with coffee dominating. Dark chocolate, roasted malts and a touch of prunes. Its semi-dry on the palate, the alcohol is well hidden and theres a pleasant carbonation level. Dried fruits, coffee, roasted malts and some brown sugar and caramel. Lasting finish with roasted malts and coffee. Perhaps a bit too much roasted malt dominated, but its sure a fine one. 140830

Beigie head, but quickly disappearing, nice lacing. Aroma of malts, almost no noticeable alcohol, unfortunately there is also small iron note. Good coffe taste, some chocolate?? Dark matl is noticeable too, carbonation is high, bitternes could be higher

Vintage 2013. Piwo ciemne prawie nieprzezroczyste, z bezowa piana sredniej wielkosci i niestety szybko opadajacej. Ale aromat sliwek skompanych w rumie, daktyle i kokosowa skorupa. W smaku zas slodycz, taka tortowa, oraz nieco palonego slodu, winna taninosc i na koniec przeplatajace sie smaki palone z kawa, wytrawny finisz i nieco rozgrzewajacego efektu w gardle. Alkohol niewyczuwalny. Etykieta chwali sie medalem i jest wzorowo opisana.

Tasted from bottle 33 cl. 14.08.2014 @ beerfest. Zwevegem.
Black color, and a beige head.
Aroma: coffee, sweet, chocolate note. Medium tot full body.
Taste: sweet, roasted malts, coffee and choclate, bitterness. Bitter finish.

Tiene un aspecto marrón oscuro, casi negro, casi opaco.
Un aroma muy complejo, parecido a un café, tostado , pasas y apuntes de chocolate.
Un sabor a café, apuntes de chocolate. Amargura en nivel medio.

Very deep, dark color, not so creamy, rather thin looking. Aroma of rye bread and bit of dark chocolate. Slightly bitter and a bit salty taste. Creamier than it looks, and pleasant carbonation. Long finish, like very dark chocolate, but much better than expected from a 9% beer.
Mörk, mörk brun med latte färgat skum. Doft: Kanderat socker, kaffe, lakrits, rostat. Smak: Samma som doft + kakao.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Levi. Black with tan head. Chocolate, a little nutty aroma, very roasty, soy and some toffee in the mouth. full body, smooth, creamy, soft carbonation, long, chocolatey finish.

At a tasting, many thanks Levi, thick bubbly head, deep brown colour with deep red streaks, aroma of chocolate cake, dark chocolate, very dark bread, a hint of dirt and maybe a hint of dried fruits, flavour of smokey charred eggplant, bittersweet chocolate and cocoa. Wonderfully balanced, really excellent.
Butelka (z data do 27.10.2015). Aromat karmelu, palono?ci i czekolady. W smaku bardzo du?o s?odowo?ci, palono?ci. Du?o tre?ci. Alkohol nie wyczuwalny. Ma?e nasycenie.

Parasta ennen: 17.08.2015. Perus portteri eli tumma, kermainen vaahto, niukka. Tuoksussa vanhaa sikaria, tummuutta, alkoholia. Suutuntuma pehmeä, alkoholinen, samettinen, hivenen tunkkainen. Kahvinen jälkimaku joka jää suuhun, kuten lievästi myös vanhan stögiksen aromi. Mukava alkoholin jälkipolte. Ei aivan maultaan yllä parhaimpien Puolalaisten porterien joukkoon, aromeiltaan kyllä.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Levi. Blsck with a light brown head. Aroma of dark chocolate, roast, a licorice note and light fruitiness. Sweetish malty flavor, roasty, somewhat smoky, with some dark chocolate, a light fruity hint and a drier finish. Quite full-bodied and rounded. Good stuff.

Baltic porter was the first style Ive ever tried - apart from lager, that is - so theres a lot of warm feelings for BP in me. Rich, toasty body - notes of dark bread, chocolate and perhaps coffee. Decent head. Great bang for a buck.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2016 Bootle 500ml. W barwie ciemno brunatne, klarowne ze stabilną beżową pianą drobnopęcherzykową. Nisko nasycone, piana ładnie zdobi szkło. 
W aromacie duża paloność, czekoladowość, melanoidy, lekka kawowość. W smaku duża słodowa paloność, czekoladowość i lekka alkoholowość i kawowość. Goryczka kawowo-palona , lekko alkoholowa. Dobra pijalność pomimo 9% alkoholu, świetny porter bałtycki.

W aromacie przede wszystkim kawa i paloność, lekkie kwaśne owoce, trochę czekolady. Kolor - ciemna wiśnia przechodząca w brąz. Piana średnio pęcherzykowa, lacing jest, ale średni. W smaku bardzo mocna kawa i ciemna czekolada, a także trochę świeżej, owocowej kwaśności. Goryczka średnia, ale długa, lekko ściągająca. Po łyku w ustach czuć też alkohol, który rozgrzewa przełyk. Wysycenie średnie, dla mnie nieco za wysokie.

Awesome beer. One of the best baltic porter present at the market at the moment. Completely black color. In aroma and taste a lot of dark bread, caramel and coffee. Also a little bit of citrus and herbs. Only the alcohol might be better covered but after all its a very strong beer so its still unbelievable pleasant to drink.

Aroma: caramel, chocolate, sausage; Appearance: pitch-black with brown reflexes, medium head; Taste: slight bitterness, slight sourness, medium sweetness; Palate: soft carbonation, oily texture, medium body, abrupt finish. Decent beer, not too bitter though.

DAAIS; Pours dark brown with a lasting, creamy, leaving lacings tan head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, dark dried, ripe fruits, coffe and dark chocolate with alcohol and vanilla notes. Taste is moderate to heavy sweet, moderate bitter, warming and chocolate lasting. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy, carbonation is soft.

500 ml bottle, clear dark brown color almost black with caramel color head. taste are roast malts with strong cafe aroma and caramel sweetness and nice bitter. aftertaste are roast malt and chocolate aroma with bitter, one of the best baltic porters so far

Pours dark brown almost black, with biege head. Sweet aroma of raisins and port wine, together with hints of chocolate. Taste is similar, sweet with strong taste of alcohol. Long a bit smoky aftertaste.
chocolate, coffee, roasty, black, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, sticky, soft carbonation, long finish,
You could find better porters in "premium quality" branch. it is good, but not the best. Maybe my opinion is dictated by my high expectations and Im overreacting, but I was a little disapointed.

Black colour, tan head. Chocolate, coffee, roasted malts, dry plum in nose. Taste: chocolate/coffee liquier like Baileys, vanilla, fried caramel, grainy, dry dark fruits, red wine, just delicate hints of ash and peat. Smooth and perfect ballanced. Im shocked at the moment - world class baltic porter!

Butelka 0.5L.

Wygląd: Brunatno-rubinowe, klarowne. Piana beżowa niewielka ale drobnopęcherzykowa, trwała, z bardzo dobrym lacingiem.

Aromat: Czekolada, suszona śliwka, kawa, melanoidyny, wiśnia, lekko winny.

Smak: Mocno palone, kawowe, wiśnia w czekoladzie, likier kawowo-wiśniowy. Alkohol lekko wyczuwalny (piwo w temp. pokojowej) ale bardzo dobrze ułożony. Dość długi posmak kawy zbożowej. Goryczka niska, kawowo-palona , lekko wzmocniona alkoholem.

Odczucie: W ustach bardzo gładkie, oleiste, piwo pełne, wysycenie średnie.

Całość: Świetny porter bałtycki, jeden z lepszych.
Ciekawie z?o?ona kompozycja aromatow , wyczuwalna kawa i nuta czekolady. Palony przyjemny porter

Palono??, karmel, kawa i goezka czekolada w aromacie. Smak kawa, palone s?ody, kawa z lekkim kwaskiem oraz gorzka czekolada. Piana przy nalewaniu obfita, drobna w joloeze be?owymz czasemvredukuje si? do obr?czki wokó? ?cianek szk?a, zostaje do ko?ca pi?knie oblepiaj?c szk?o. Alkohol szlachetny, rozgrzewa delikatnie ?o??dek. Bardzo dobre piwo do posiedzenia przed kominkiem.

w aromacie sporo karmelu, lekka kawa, bardzo stylowo. W smaku również przeważa karmel, kawa na finiszu, pełne, niezbyt słodkie, nuty ciemnych owoców, melanoidyny, nieźle złożone, dobrze ukryty alkohol. Na pewno piłem ciekawsze portery bałtyckie, piłem też gorsze.

Recenzja z 04.03.2014, nielezakowany. Kolor prawie czarny, klarowne. Piana wysoka, powoli opada, zostawia gruba warstwe, troche oblepia szklo. W zapachu kawa, tyton, popiol, suszone owoce z domimujaca sliwka i rodzynkami, bardzo swiezy i rzeski aromat. W smaku pelne, ale malo slodkie, intensywna palonosc i suszone owoce, dosc mocno wyczuwalny alkohol, ale jako przyjemne rozgrzewanie, intensywna kawa zbozowa. Goryczka niska w strone sredniej, aromat trawiasty, mocno sciagajaca i lodygowa, wzmacniana przez piekacy alkohol. Wysycenie niskie.
Big fat Baltic. Roast and chocolate, wine and fruit. Bready dark malt, full palate but not sticky sweet. Blackinsk brown pour, dark tan cap.

Piwo o ładnym ciemnym kolorze i gęstej kremowej pianie, która niestety dość szybko znika. W aromacie nuty palone, czekoladowe i kawowe. W smaku czekoladowa słodycz połączona z kawową palonością i odrobiną goryczki. Jeden z lepszych polskich porterów bałtyckich.

BOTTLE 50CL.

Look: almost opaque black, beige frothy head.
Aroma: intense toasted and chocolaty aroma, berries, light smoke even.
Taste: roasted, moderate bitterness, chocolate, ashy finish.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2016 The aroma is mostly of chocolate, with hints of coffee and caramel; alcohol is also very clearly there. Pours black with a very small head. Tastes sweet and only a little bit bitter; not very easy to taste the actual beer behind the alcohol. Creamy, medium carbonation, bitter-tart finish. Rather typically for the Fortuna brewery, this tastes more like a fizzy drink with third-rate vodka.

Aroma of chocolate and coffee. qiute good headwith nice lacing. medium bitterness, medium body, average carbonation, long bitter finish. Nowadays one of the best Baltic porters, but sometimes you can find better or worse batch.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2014 Very thick-set and dense cream-to-beige head over jet-black beer. Sweet, burnt, mocha, roasted coffeebeans, bit earthy. Sweet, but inviting. Sweet-roasted, sugared strong coffee, dark (but not bitter) chocolate; sweet roastmeat without saltiness, maltsyrup. Again earthy retronasal. Very creamy MF, rather well-bodied without becoming heavy, medium carbonation. Quite decent strong(er) porter, but its sweetness might have gotten a better balance from some extra hops. Dziękuję bardzo, aga i tatę!

Piwo posiada bogactwo aromatów zgodnych ze stylem, czyli kawa, śliwka, cukierki truflowe, czekolada. Piana kremowa, drobno i średnioziarnista  jak na mój gust zbyt szybko zredukowana do delikatnej obwódki. Goryczka prawie idealna dla tego stylu, nie zauważalna, a jednak przeciwdziała zalepieniu się słodyczą z tego piwa. Oczywiście w odczuciu obecne nuty alkoholowe oraz uczucie rozgrzania, ale jest to uczucie przyjemne i zgodne z oczekiwaniami. W smaku początek słodki, ale czym bliżej finiszu tym silniejsze smaki kontrujące: kwaskowatość od palonych słodów oraz alkohol.

Bottle. I am truly amazed by the latest batch which offers a stunning aroma of coffee and raisins. Smell is fastidiously confirmed by the taste. My only reservation is texture- could be thicker and richer for 22 degrees plato. World class and all the accolades are no coincidence

Bottle, thanks a zillion to the great Eldesmadre! This is a very interesting Baltycki porter, with little more than a rusty Dunkel aroma when in the bottle. Now, having said that, as soon as it pours, a strong Nutellical scent blooms out, sweet, of course, with milk chocolate and a good dose of hazelnuts. The beer is a dark coca cola appearance, with very little head (off-white) to be excited about, but the flavour is a new surprise, very distinct from most other dark beers: yes, there is a great dose of Italian hot chocolate (the thick ones) and there is Dutch salty liquorice, but also that wonderful, mysterious miracle elixir, a syrupy concoction with a much more enticing and subtle Kräuter note, and I use the more as a comparison to its other Polish or Lithuanian neighbour porters. It is rather boozy and tremendously salty, which I find terrific! The finish is salty and creamy sweet, brief, and that very evident alcohol is not offensive, but just charming enough to make it a fantastically warming porter. Medium bodied, I find it an enchanting pint!

It would be near-perfect if not the irony notes. Seriously, everything in this beer is proper, except for that little thing.Smell is really strong, packed with chocolate and dark malty goodness, dense and full with some liquorish hints and raisins in chocolate. It would be really impressive if not the Irony note which is fortunately nicely hidden, although easy to trace during the skin test.Flavour just gets better and is pretty complex, starts pretty sweet with some liquorish notes, then comes the chocolate and mildly bitter, alcoholic finish.Some of higher alcohols can be felt on palate, along with slightly warming finish. Medium carbonation, full, silky body, extremely tasty and good.Naily smell was the only dissapointment. Of course it is pitch black like it should be, head drops to a ring after a while, but has nice retention. I hope that the batch which recieved bronze on World Beer Cup was free of this tiny flaw.

Butelka. Aromat palony, czekoladowy, kawowy, karmelowy, palonych słodów. Ponadto likierowy, pralinowy, delikatna wanilia. Alkohol świetnie ukryty. W smaku jest paloność, czekolada ciemna, kawa, czekoladki z likierem. Alkohol jest przyjemny, rozgrzewający. Piwo jest gładkie i jedwabiste w ustach.
coffe, chocolate, raisins aroma, full taste, not sweet, quite strong roasted malt taste (I like it in this beer), colour black (really black), the best baltic porter

Nice malty chocolatey aroma, deep, dark, yet extremely clear. A bit harsh on the finish especially for a Baltic Porter. Darker malts are a bit more prominent than I would like for this style. I like this beer but prefer other versions of the style.

Colour: black opaque. Head: small, fine grained, poor retention. Aroma: coffee, cocoa, slight liquorice, sweet. Taste: coffee, cocoa and more cocoa. Alcoholic in the beginning but the aftertaste is pure cocoa. Very sweet, malt heavy.

Bottle. Beaten eggwhite head, that begs for a bonus. Amazingly deep aroma of chocolate, ground cocoa, a generous amount of licorice, some roast and notes of vanilla. But the flavour manages even to surpass that. All that is in the aroma, just bigger, better, more. The chocolate part is stronger at the expense of the licorice, it is full, light sweet and pleasantly warming in the light bitter, light coffeeish finish. Amazing!

Bottle. Pours very dark, almost black with a decent head. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, dried fruits. Taste - roasted malts, coffee, fruits. Beer is full bodied,medium carbonation, rather sweet. Little warming from alcohol. good baltic porter.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2017 Bottle. Aroma is coffee, chocolate, maltiness, dried fruits. Very dark with ruby reflexes, great head, good lacing. In taste very nice coffee, dark malts, dried fruits, chocolate, more roastiness than in aroma. Beer is full bodied, creamy with medium carbonation. Nice light warming from alcohol. Very very good beer.

Barwa: głęboko rubinowa, bardzo ciemna, prawie nie przejrzysta nawet pod światło.

Aromat: dominują akcenty czekoladowo - kawowe, lekko owocowe. Zdecydowanie przyjemny, choć początkowo wyczuwalna zdecydowana nuta alkoholowa. 

Smak: raczej słodki niż wytrawny, bowiem piwo jest dość młode. Akcenty czekolady i kawy mokka. Bardzo miłe w odbiorze, choć raczej do spokojnego sączenia, ze względu na sporą moc. Alkoholowość wyczuwalna, ale nie przeszkadza. 

Bardzo dobre piwo z gatunku, który powinien być naszym narodowym skarbem. Niestety zanikającym. W przeszłości prawie każdy browar warzył portera, obecnie występuje on znacznie rzadziej. Tym bardziej trzeba go docenić. W kraju mamy z tym problem, natomiast za granicą zdobyło on Złoty Medal w konkursie European Beer Star 2013 w kategorii Porterów Bałtyckich. To już o czymś świadczy. Moim zdaniem obok Portera Warmińskiego absolutna krajowa czołówka.

Piana po nalaniu bardzo ładna, drobna, beżowa. Niestety szybko opada i zostaje odrobina. Aromat dość złożony, palony, słodki, czuć coś ciekawego, kawowego. Smakuje bardzo dobrze, mniej słodko niż wynikałoby z zapachu, co mi pasuje i pozytywnie zaskakuje. Jest dość wytrawne, palone, kawowe, trochę kwaskowe. Ścisła czołówka najlepszych porterów.
Amazing beer. Sweetness is balanced by hoppy bitterness. Coffee and - in lower grade - chocolate aroma and taste as well. Full body. Great.

Bottle.
Nice, 2 finger head. Almost black, clear (under strong light) body. 
Aroma of chocolate and some roastiness.
In taste there is some sweetness with medium bitterness.
Strong chocolate flavout, with warming alcohol.
Beer has creamy texture, soft carbonation making it perfect for long, winter evening. Short warming finish makes it even better. 
Very good baltic porter, one of the best.
coffee, black, long finish, chocolate, light sweetness, medium bitterness,

As most of Polish Baltic Porters, it is really nice. Pours black, with nice head. Aroma is plums, chocolate, coffee, raisins. Medium full body, low carbonation. Medium bitterness, some delicate sourness from roasted malts, nice coffee and chocolate, well hidden alcohol. I like it

Bottle. Pours clear dark chestnut with a small, creamy beige head. Aroma has liqourice, roasted, dark chocolate, nuts. Low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has good liqourice, soft salty, good dark chocolate, metallic, a bit of smoke, soft elegance. Quite delicious.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2014 (PL) Piana bardzo niska, średnio-pęcherzykowa. Aromat kawowy, lekko palony. W smaku znacznie bardziej wyczuwa się paloność. Goryczka średnia. Średnio pijalne. Mogłoby być bardziej wytrawne (mniej pijalne). Po kupnie trzeba trochę z nim poczekać (leżakować), żeby nabrał porządnego porterowego smaku.

Appearance: black, with very thin, tan head, that drops quickly. Poor lacing.

Aroma: very nice, coffee and roasted malts, some caramel in the back. Not intense, but very pleasant.

Taste: roastiness, coffee and malts. Rather dry. Bitterness on an average level. No alcohol aftertaste.

Mouthfeel: full bodied, medium to soft carbonation.

Overall: one of my favourite baltic porters. I like how its dominated by roastiness instead of sweetness. Its not an "in your face" type of beer, rather one to sit with in the evening and drink one bottle for like an hour. Room temperature is this beer best friend.

Enjoyed from a snifter.

Bottle. Expire date: 11.06.2015 Almost black color, against the light ruby. Small, beige head - lacing glass. Lovely aroma. Roasted dark malts, coffee, coffee grains, dried fruits, liqueur, bread, Taste: dried fruits, coffee grains, roasted dark malts, caramel, gentle alcohol. Long warming finish. Full body with medium carbonation. Good example of Polish Baltic Porters.
Pours deep dark ruby red color with a small head. Aroma of malts and caramel. Flavor of malt, caramel. Dry palate, sweetish finish.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2014 Fantastic baltic porter from Komes / Fortuna Brewery. Toasted coffee, dark chocolate. Very drinkable. A bit on a sweet side, but it does not bother. For me the most drinkable example of the style. Awarded best baltic porter in Europe!
Fragrance is a bit nutty, malty, medium sweet. Taste is more roasted and has a bit of bitterness. Malty, a bit caramel-like mouthfeel. Nice finish with grain-like notes.

Beige head goes away quickly. 
Medium body (I would expect it to be thicker at 21 plato).
Smells and tastes of coffee, dark chocolate and caramel. Bitter, with sour finish.
Alcohol is well hidden. 
Really nice.

50 cl bottle @ Gastropub Nordic.
Pours deep dark ruby red color with a small head. Aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla, some wood and toffee. Flavor of malts, vanilla, caramel, wood and faint syrupy notes. Dry malty palate, sweetish finish. Nice and balanced.
4415

50cl bottle. Dark brown with a medium, tanned head. 
NOSE : toffee, caramel, coffee with milk. Quite typical nose for a porter with some distinct cheesy and sweet aromas. 
SIP : medium body with moderate carbonation. A typical roasted, burned caramel malt body for the style. More on a sweet note though. It develops roasted dry flavors along the way. OVERALL : sweet and salty with a roasted finish. Not bad. Typical but has a character of its own. A bit too sweet though.

I think its slightly better than the Ciechan porter but not as good as Zywiecs porter. A LOT of coffee, but basically no chocolate. Maybe thats only for imperial stouts. There is liquorice too. Some alcohol in it and head that goes away rather quickly. Enjoyable and wouldnt mind it again if Polish beer were more common in Sweden. Like that the Poles dont mess much with 33cl and mostly goes for 50cl bottles. However with really strong beers it might be enough with half. Anyway they are really inexpensive in Poland compared to beer in Sweden. This one was about 6 zlotys in the carrefour (less than 2 $).

0,5l. bottle, batch 2012. Dark with ruby reflexes, avarage brown head. Aroma of chocolate, cofee, cherries and, unfortunately bit alcohol. Good, alcohol in taste is covered, bitterness and sweetness are well balanced. Mild sourness from dark malt can be tasted in finish. Mouthfeel is ok, but might expect more full body. Very nice, award-winnning beer.

Appearance: Transparent black color with a fine beige head that leaves a nice lacing.Aroma: Mild chocolate, roasted malt and coffee.Palate: Medium body. Tad sweet and a mild bitterness. Average to soft carbonation. Dry texture.Taste: Roasted malt, coffee and mild pleasant chocolate. Well masked alcohol.Overall impression: Lovely tasty ale.Personal stats: Bottle from a trade with EIDesmadre

Bottle
Aroma-chocolate, coffee, caramel, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-lightly sour, lightly bitter, light sweetness, 
Palate-full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, bitter-sour finish

Intensive aroma of chocolate and roasted malts. Small, quickly disappearing head. Dark brown body. Very sweet chocolate and caramel taste with some roasted bitterness.
Bottled. A black beer with a lazing tan head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt and soy sauce. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, soy sauce, and bread, leading to a dry roasted finish.
Czarny z czekoladową pianą, silnie palony z nutą gorzkiej czekolady w zapach słodu z nutą suszonych śliwek.

Dark brown colour, medium and quickly dissappearing head. Sweet aroma of licorice, cherry with alcohol. Taste is sweet with some sherry notes on the beginning. After that appears lots of chocolate and coffee. Long dry finish.Medium to high carbonation. Full body. Really decent baltic porter, but not as good as Żywiec Porter.
2012 bottle. Deep dark brown color. Coffee, roast and licorice in the aroma. Malty sweet, creamy flavor with loads of licorice. Potentially good, but out of balance.

Bottle at Deans stickiest floor tasting. Pours a reddish black beer with a small, beige head on top. Aroma of coffee, dark chocolates and roasted malts. Flavor has a lot of coffee, chocolate and sweet licorice. Aftertaste has a lot of sweet, strong chocolate flavors and lasts very long. Nice brew.

Bottle shared at the Press Deans Button tasting. Pours clear dark reddish brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of malt, caramel, chocolate. Flavour is over moderate sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at Deansos monthly tasting, September 2013. Poured a clear very dark reddish brown. The aroma is rich, malty with a little resin. The flavour is is weak bitter, woody with some medicinal notes.

Bottle @ "Press Deans button tasting". Very dark brown to black color with a deep dark red glare coming through, small brown head. Smell malts, leaves, caramel. Taste malts, caramel, alcohol, lightly leaves. Medium body, medium to full carbonation.
Bottle. Pours clear brown. Aroma is coffee and ash. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Full bodied and light carbonation.
Poured dark reddish brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of roast malt, dark chocolate, light coffee. Full body, flavour as the aroma, sweet end.

Bottle shared @ JMDST
Thin creamy tan head. Clear deep burgundy pour. Lovely smooth baltic porter.

(bottle) pours a clear deepest ruby colour with a frothy beige head. aroma of coffee, chocolate fudge and heavy liquorice, with a light hint of soy sauce, earth and roasted malts. flavour is heavy toasted malts and coffee, initially quite meaty, with strong notes of dark chocolate, ash and a light-bitter alcoholic finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2014 Very strong beer. You can feel the alcohol. The head disappears quickly. The color is beautiful black/dark maroon. Burnt coffee notes both in nose and mouth, also some sour notes. Aftertaste is long coffee finish with initial booze. Too strong for me, but quite drinkable.

Bottle. Black beer with a thick tan head. Roast malt and caramel on the nose. Flavour has all sorts going on. Liquorice, coffee, burnt toast and a barely concealed booziness which offers a warmth. Not really a hot day beer although I did drink it on an exceedingly hot day.
0,5l bootle. Beer has got almost nice black colour. I fell a caffe aroma note. Very nice and strong aroma of black beer. Carmel and caffe taste.

0.5 l brown bottle, ugly and negligently glued label, contadictory and quite disputable hostoric information included in it. On the good side - the back label contains info on maturing process and how flavor and aroma would potentially change over next 18 months. My tasting sample is 6 months old and according to the label its supposed to be fresh and roasted.
Pasteaurized so unlike two other Komeses - was not bottle conditioned
Aroma: caramel, chocolate, coffee, raisin, roasted barley, dark fruit (prunes), no hop trace
Appearance: very dark black, brown creamy foam, that disappeared quite quickly but left nice rings on the glass
Taste: Mixed medium dry sourness with chocolate balance and roasted barley hit. Bitter to some extent but it does not come from hops, rather from dark malt. One sure thing is about this porter - its not oily sweet which makes it very drinkable (be careful its 9% abv) Thick texture with soft carbonation. Medium long finish with the taste of soil for some reason.

Good one, will get back to it definitely.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2014 500ml bottle (Małe Piwo, Warsaw) - Shared with SRPOL - thanks!  (7:5:6:4:13=3.5)
Black, tight tan head. Superb roasty aroma. A touch sour retronasals. Massive esters too. Big roasty maltiness in the mouth, quite burnt, but not astringent. Late finish is pure espresso. Harsh in places, and a bit too alcoholic, alas. The late coffee finish is the big win. Very drinkable, despite the strength.
Rerate: 500ml bottle (Nordic, Tampere) (7+:4:7:4:14=3.6+)
Lovely sweet rich burnt porter. Lovely sweet roast. Coffee finish. Very tasty.
Wytrawny i kawowy, ale też trochę kwaskowy, przez co nie piję się go tak źle. Jednak raczej wolę żywieckiego portera.

Bottle brought back from Poland by a work colleague. Black beer with lasting tan head. Some liquorice and soy sauce on aroma. A little heat, some choc some coffee, some heat. some liquorice on the finish. Decent in mouth. OK.
UPDATED: NOV 1, 2013 Clear, dark brown color. Chocolate, coffee and roasted malt aroma. Light sweet. Bitter finish. Average carbonation.
Bottle. Black with a tan head. Coffee toasted malt in the aroma and flavour, hint of Tia Maria in the finish

Bottle. Very dark and very strong porter. Chocolate, coffee tones in taste, small smoke hints in palate. Interesting.

500ml bottle from some Alkohole in Krakow. Pours a black body with a finger-width, creamy, brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is sweeter caramels and chocolates with a nice dark fruit and light roast note. Touches of nuts and licorice as well. Flavor is similar. On the sweeter side with some caramels, nutty toffees, and chocolate, but well balanced by a light roast. A good amount of dark fruits before this finishes sweet, but dry and decently roasted. Lengthy aftertaste following a fuller body and a light carbonation. Overall, a bigger and sweeter Baltic Porter, but pretty well balanced and tasty. Good one.

I kulturtexter talas det gärna om civilisationens tunna fernissa. Låter man det resonemanget jäsa lite - så att det blir flytande i fyllehicka - är det alkoholsmaken som är den där barbarin under civilisationens tunna fernissa. I Fortuna Komes Porter förnimmer man ölets primitiva ursprung i spridda klunkar - 9 procent är det svårt att hymla med - men den råa kärnan är tillräckligt polerad för att inte sticka alltför mycket i strupen. En porter som inte drar skam och vanära över sin glorvyrdiga ätt. Dricks med fördel i ett källarvalv i Gdansk.

0.5 bottle. Extremely dark crimson color only distinguishable from black due to some reddish reflexes, medium brown head on top. Strong malty aroma; roasted malts, loads of coffee and smoke. Taste is moderately bitter; smoke, charred wood, coffee, and some toast as well, balanced and consummate. Full body, thick texture and slightly more than soft carbonation. Finish is looooong, again some charred wood, bitter yet distinguished. All in all it is a marvellous beer.
Bottle, 9%. Salty aroma. Black colour, no head. The flavour is salt liquorice and alcohol. Good balance if you like Små Blå.
Bottle. Pours cloudy dark brown with small but stable light tan head. Dark aroma of roasted malt, caramel and coffee. Ditto flavour. Very well-balanced. Salmiak finish. An ok Baltic Porter.
500ml bottle. Deep taste with coffee and caramel nutes. Roasted palate. Long, bitter and coffee-like finish. White head disappearing fast. Black colour with some browny reflexes.
taste is the core of this beer - deep, firm and strong. chocolate, coffee, some brandy tones... and very impressive feeling on tongue. Maybe aroma is too alcoholic. Great and well - brewed.
Dark brown, almost black body, light brown head. Aroma has molasses, dark roasted malt and sugars, some chocolate. Flavour has cabbage, cocoa, peas, sugary sweetness, some metal.
Black pour, quickly dissipating off-white head. Flavor is smooth bitter chocolate, coffee and roasty. A lot better than the aroma.

0.5l bottle kindly traded with ElDesmadre. While pouring it it looks dark brown, but in the glass its massive black and totally impossible to detect any brown edges even when holding it against the light. It has a massive gigantic and lasting fluffy brown head thats really lacing down the glass. On the aroma this one is well roasted with clear espresso powder and chocolate tones and a twitch of burned dark syrup. Also a bit sweet with a good dash of hops and perhaps just a hint of blackberries and cardboard as well. Really nice. Lets taste it; oh yeah! Lots and lots of flavor! Good oily texture with a average carbonation level. Heavy roasted - or dare I say burned malts, thick and really dark bitter chocolate, its both sweet and hoppy and the enormous aftertaste of dark espresso coffee and Belgian chocolate is really lasting. There is also a suiting warming hint of alcohol long long out there in the aftertaste. Really tasty and delicious! 24.04.2012
Bottle. Dark brown color with creamy head. Aroma of roasted malts. Rich smoky tones of roasted malts in taste. Little sweet tones at the beginning, after more bitter notes. Smoky bitter finish.

Slightly abrupt finish, but nevertheless one of the best baltic porters available in PL.

Mély sötét sörrel van dolgunk, hatalmas, lassan oszló arisztokratikus habbal. A teste inkább kecses, mint robosztus, de semmiképpen sem vékony. Az ízei elég egyértelmű vonalat rajzolnak ki: boros, pörköltmalátás, erősen alkoholos, és végül súlyosan hordós. Turistának érezzük magunkat egy ódon várkastélyban, lassú nyikorgással záródó évszázados tölgyfaajtók, dohos szegletek, rozsdás páncélok, borzasztóan evokatív - igazi bársonyos vadállat, Az egyik legjobb lengyel porter.

Botle at Smocza Jama in Krakow. Black colored beer with almost no head. Soft carbonation. Cremy mouthfeel with a lot of pure chocolate and coffee notes in aroma and taste. Some dark fruits like plums and raisins. Alcohol is very well hidden.

0,5 l bottle courtesy of Tonycaviar.
Poured dark mahagony.brown, some ruby tones in color, foamy tan head that melts down slowly. Aroma of toasted caramel, roasted malts, some vinous burnt casks, spicies and chocolate, vanilla and fruits. Oily body, heavy flavor of roasted malt and dark chocolate, some molasses and caramel, fruits like plum and raisins, light burnt woods, peat. Wow, that was delicious!

50cl bottle in the "Dragons Hole" Krakow. Dark brown color with a maroon highlight around the edges. Nice, sweeter malt aroma. Big caramel malt in the flavor but balanced nicely with some bitterness. A little syrup and coffee leftover on your lips. Really no hint of the 9 ABV.

bottle, traded with Schroppfy - bardzo dziekuje! Deep black colour, large and creamy beige head - looks very promising. Intensive aroma of roasdted malts and chocolate, quite spicy. Spicy start with light notes of alcohol dtectable, though in the far backgrund. Chocolate, roasetd malts, espresso coffee and cocoa powder. No fruity hints here. Different to the Baltic Porter from Ciechanów and also extremely delicious and moreish.

Thanks to Randers Crew. Dark, almost black and clear. Has a light-brown head, lasting. Aroma of burnt bread and coffee. Toast too. Flavor is mainly sweet, but has a nice bitter finish. Creamy texture, dry too. Soft carbonation.

Bottle. Courtesy Saxo. Creamy light brown good mostly lasting head. Dark red-amber colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. lacks roaste and licorice. Moderate bitter roasted flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. not very well-balnced. Oily palate.
coffee, caramel, black, brown foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish.
Bottle from Dom Piwa. Nice creamy head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are roast malt, licorice, coffee, caramel and hops.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2011 This looks to be better than the other Polish contenders, Warminskie and Amber Grand, on account of the actual real roastiness present in the aroma. Lovely, finally, really great fresh forest and fire smoke. Lovely. The aroma is definitely all that. Very solid body, yet punctuated by a lasting ring of foam. The flavor is a huge component of fermented raisins, but also woody, earthy, just plain sweet...not much of the flat iron molasses quality but still good!

text:
Seal brown under a light tan head. Prune and sulfur aroma initially, slight waft coffee and molasses. Quite dry with moderate acidity and a strong roasty presence marrying into a gentle hop bitterness. Reserved coffee and dry chocolate flavors. Medium bodied, powdery texture, brisk carbonation. Surprisingly gentle for the alcohol content, perhaps a little too much so as I enjoy whats going on here and wish there was more of it.

50 cl bottle, shared by Jukkabro.

Aroma is smokey, burnt coffee, dark chocolate and pitfruit, dead black, slim toffee head. Flavour has liquorice, rich coffee, tasted malt and red plums. Full bodied, wonderful balance, bitter and very warming. Majestic! Thank You Radek Kliber.
Muddy chestnut brown.  Gentle toffee nose with caramel and a vague nuttiness.  Very soft body with beautiful toffee notes, fresh hazelnuts and a vague fruitiness.

Deep brown with mahogany hue in the light, tan head. Sweet malty aromatic. Yielding nose offers lovely raisins and aged balsamic. Smooth, silken, low carbonation is nice. Smooth, not roasty, not sweet--just fits neatly into a pocket. Solid.

(BBE 5/08) Near black colored with red hints, medium sized beige head. Sweet roasted coffee aroma with chocolate too, nice warming alcohol also here with some weird vinous note. Excellent aroma. Medium to full bodied. Flavor is also sweet with roastiness and chocolate, not too porterish one though. Aftertaste has some alcohol. Soft flavored, good one.
Another good Polish porter.  Black with white bubbly head.  Boozy, licorice, some interesting sourness.  SOme chocolate.

Slight initial tartness blended with roasted barley. Molasses , soy sauce with late slight smoky woody touches. Decent new Baltic from Poland but it does lack some class and "polish" of top brews(sic)

Bottle brown, 500 ml, 21.0 P
Appearance: Head is dark brown, reddish, cooper or rust like even, frothy, nice, regular in structure, body is full, looks esentially and heavy. Head gives decent lacing, body is very deep dark, red to brown but so intense that almost pitch black in colour and reminds Zywiec Porter. head is no lasting for a notable period of time though, body is gently carbonating but looks so black that sparkling is not visible.
Aroma: Mild alcohol, refreshing, cherry, coal, burned wood, caramel, plum, typical aroma for good quality porter, which gives some hints of spices, ginger, gingerbread.
Flavour: Not sweet, bitterness, burned sugar, roastyness, accidic, ash-pot, roasty nose what is interesting, after you swallow the beer. On palate a bit tangy and what is surprising in this kind of beer rather no expected taste of sourcraut which violates the charmony of the taste. Texture is thick, syrupy but not sweet.
Palate: Finish duration is short to medium, a bit sticky, not much sweet, texture is syrupy to wattery.
